page.title: 01 COASTAL BIRDLIFE
page.content: Marshes harbour Moorhens,Mallard and Reed Buntings with Sedge Warblers and the occasional Grasshopper Warblers in Summer and at other seasons, Snipe, Teal, Wigion,Twite,Corn Bunting and Water Rail. Coastal heathland and duneland is favoured by Meadow Pipits and Skylarks and the occasional Stonechat.In Spring and Autumn Wheatear and Whinchats can very often be seen here with flocks of Tree Sparrows, Chaffinch,Greenfinch and Brambling flying past.Swallows, Swifts and Martins very often migrate along this coastal strip.In winter Short-Eared Owls occur and the occasional Hen Harrier,Merlin and Peregrine Falcons.
